Hi,

When doing an assertEquals( string , string ), if either of
the Strings is null then JUnit throws a NullPointerException.
I am guessing that this is because of the new string comparison work.
To see this behaviour try


public void testCase( )
{
	assertEquals( "1234" , null );
}

It also fails the other way around i.e.

assertEquals( null , "1234" );

I will be quite happy to patch this if this has not already been done,
but don't wish to duplicate work if it already has been done.

I have a feeling this will catch a few people out.


Kind Regards,
Shaun.
